CatDescriptText: Lawrence Law, social caseworker, 1109 Sisca Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the hospital service rendered under Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber? Do you think the rates should be raised?  Why?"  answer reads: "No, I don't think that they are.  I think that, perhaps they are abusing the income from the program.  There are a lot of cases in which the doctors are over-charging because the people have Blue Cross coverage.  As to whether or not the rates should be raised, I can't say because I don't know about them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lawrence Law wearing dark suit jacket, dark striped necktie, and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
